name: William FIORE, individually and trading and doing business as Municipal and Industrial Disposal Company, Appellant, Charles DURITSA, Regional Solid Waste Manager, Department of Environmental Resources, and Hugh V. Archer, Regional Water Quality Manager, Bureau of Water Quality Management, Department of Environmental Resources

judges: Before NIX, C.J., and LARSEN, FLAHERTY, McDER-MOTT, HUTCHINSON, ZAPPALA and PAPADAKOS, JJ.
parties: William FIORE, individually and trading and doing business as Municipal and Industrial Disposal Company, Appellant, Charles DURITSA, Regional Solid Waste Manager, Department of Environmental Resources, and Hugh V. Archer, Regional Water Quality Manager, Bureau of Water Quality Management, Department of Environmental Resources.

opinions.text:
ORDER
PER CURIAM.
Order affirmed.
PAPADAKOS, J., dissents.
opinions.author: PER CURIAM.

attorneys: Thomas F. Halloran, Jr., Deputy Atty. Gen., Pittsburgh, for appellees.
casebody.head_matter:
481 A.2d 318
William FIORE, individually and trading and doing business as Municipal and Industrial Disposal Company, Appellant, Charles DURITSA, Regional Solid Waste Manager, Department of Environmental Resources, and Hugh V. Archer, Regional Water Quality Manager, Bureau of Water Quality Management, Department of Environmental Resources.
Supreme Court of Pennsylvania.
Argued Sept. 13, 1984.
Decided Sept. 24, 1984.
Harold Gondelman, Pittsburgh, for appellants.
Thomas F. Halloran, Jr., Deputy Atty. Gen., Pittsburgh, for appellees.
Before NIX, C.J., and LARSEN, FLAHERTY, McDER-MOTT, HUTCHINSON, ZAPPALA and PAPADAKOS, JJ.
